info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central McDowell, northeastern Buncombe and southeastern Yancey Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 335 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles northeast of Downtown Asheville, or 4 miles north of Black Mountain. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marion, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Warren Wilson College, Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Montreat, Busick and Pleasant Gardens. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
